title: December 12, 2023—KB5033379 (OS Build 10240.20345) - Microsoft Support
text:
December 12, 2023—KB5033379 (OS Build 10240.20345) - Microsoft Support 
 
 
December 12, 2023—KB5033379 (OS Build 10240.20345)

For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of Windows 10, version 1507, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update addresses security issues for your Windows operating system. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update makes miscellaneous security improvements to internal OS functionality. No additional issues were documented for this release. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
December 2023 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates.  For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5032390 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
.

summary:
KB5033379 is a security update released on December 12, 2023, for Windows 10 version 1507 (OS Build 10240.20345). This update introduces miscellaneous security improvements to internal OS functionality, enhancing overall system security. No critical vulnerabilities or bugs were specifically reported as addressed; however, it is recommended to install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) KB5032390 prior to this cumulative update to ensure a smooth installation process. The update is available via various channels including Windows Update, Windows Update for Business, Microsoft Update Catalog, and WSUS configuration specific to Windows 10 security updates.

**Technical Breakdown**:

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- This update includes improvements addressing security issues, although no high-impact vulnerabilities have been explicitly identified in this release.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- **Prerequisites**:
    - Prior to installation, ensure that SSU KB5032390 is installed to mitigate potential issues during the LCU installation.
  
- **Preferred Update Channels**: 
    - **Windows Update**: Automatically downloads and installs the update.
    - **Windows Update for Business**: Follows configured policies for automatic installation.
    - **Microsoft Update Catalog**: Standalone package available for manual download.
    - **WSUS**: Configure the following for automatic synchronization:
        ```
        [WSUS Configuration]
        Product: Windows 10
        Classification: Security Updates
        ```

No uninstallation instructions or additional known issues were documented in this update.
